results.title: The Berenstain bears: Christmas tree: meet big paw: play ball
results.brief_description: This tape features three tales from the series written and created by Jan and Stan Berenstain. “The Berenstain Bears’ Christmas tree”; Papa bear, Brother bear and Sister bear are unhappy when they cannot pick out a Christmas tree. All is not lost however when a wonderful surprise awaits them at the tree house. Directed by Mordicai Gerstein. “The Berenstain bears meet big paw”; There is a Thanksgiving legend that if a bear becomes too greedy he will incur the wrath of the 90 foot high Big Paw. Despite this warning Brother and Sister bear set out looking for food in the Sinister Bog. Directed by Mordicai Gerstein and Al Kouzel. “The Berenstain Bears play ball”; It is the start of Spring and Papa bear is training young Brother bear to be a baseball star in the Little League. Directed by Al Kouzel.

results.title: The Benefits of insects
results.brief_description: There are many million times more bugs in the world than there are people, in fact one spoonful of dirt can be home to many hundreds of bugs! Students will learn the benefits of insects and their relatives to humans. This video explores the link in the food chain between insects and other small animals, the process of pollination, the stages of growth in bugs, how bugs benefit the soil, and provides examples of some of the more common bugs such as mites, ants and millipedes. Suitable for Mid-Upper Primary level students. Teachers guide included.

results.title: The Belstone Fox
results.brief_description: An inescapably moving animal adventure film starring Eric Porter as a huntsman who unwittingly pits the forces of nature against each other. Tag, an orphaned fox cub, is reared with a litter of hound puppies and through this kindly act comes tragedy for both humans and animals. Also stars Rachel Roberts, Dennis Waterman, Jeremy Kemp and Bill Travers.

results.title: The Belly of an Architect
results.brief_description: This is the story of a distinguished American architect, Stanley Kracklite, who goes to Rome’s Museum and Mausoleum of Western Art, to put on an exhibition in memory of his hero, the 18th century visionary, French architect, Etienne Louis Boullee. Kracklite becomes more and more preoccupied with his work and obsessed with his health, and in doing so alienates his wife. The visual style of the film aims for a continual background of architecture to indicate that man is persistently lost in its shadow.

results.title: The Bells of St. Mary's
results.creator_credit: RKO Radio Pictures, Rainbow Educational Video and Leo McCarey
results.brief_description: A battle of wits emerges between Father O’Malley and Sister Benedict when their ideas clash in how the children should be taught at St. Mary’s School. However, Sister Benedict takes a tip from his unusual methods and buys a boxing book and a baseball bat, then finds herself in the business of making men out of boys. It’s not Father O’Malley’s only battle. The school is badly in need of repairs and a cynical millionaire has started proceedings to condemn the school building. Starring Ingrid Bergman and Bing Crosby.

results.title: The Belle of New York
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Arthur Freed and Charles Walters
results.brief_description: A musical set in New York in the 1890s in which a playboy seeks redemption in the arms of a mission girl. This is the pretext for transforming Astaire’s past decadence into present zaniness and Vera-Ellen’s primness into sauciness. Despite the suggestion of fairytale fantasy - lovers truly in love can literally walk on air - this is at core a folk musical with an idealised New York as a slightly larger version of hometown, a community to be celebrated. Several lively dance numbers are designed to evoke the paintings of Currier and Ives. This was Astaire’s personal favourite of his musicals. Cast also includes Marjorie Main, Keenan Wynn, Alice Pearce, Clinton Sundberg, Gale Robbins. Music by Harry Warren, lyrics by Johnny Mercer.

results.title: The Belgian begonia
results.creator_credit: Belgian Ministry of Agriculture and Genevieve Grandry
results.brief_description: The cultivation of begonia tubers at Ghent for export showing the care with which they are planted and tended. Shows the flowers in colourful profusion in gardens, parks, and homes.

results.title: The Behaviour game
results.creator_credit: Lion Pacesetter Films, Barclays Bank and Ronald Spender
results.brief_description: Designed to show the contagious nature of both good and bad behavior. Opens with the proposition that innate courtesy has been the hallmark of the Englishman, then the scene shifts to one of riotous discourtesy. Ways of improving public and personnel relations are shown together with information on appropriate demeanor at work.

results.title: The Behaving brain
results.creator_credit: WGBH (Boston), Tuggelin Yourgrau and David Espar
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Discovering psychology”.
Can new computer techniques, such as brain imaging, detect whether a person is, or is likely to become, alcoholic, manic depressive or schizophrenic? Can transplanting healthy tissue into an ageing brain improve memory? In this program, Philip Zimbardo examines the structure of the brain and the scientific study of the brain - neuroscience. The scientists interviewed explain the biochemical reactions that determine our thoughts, feelings and actions.
